elements.title: Kölner Domchor (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Kölner Domchor (pictured) from Cologne Cathedral sang Palmeri's Misa a Buenos Aires at a 2013 festival in Rome dedicated to Pope Francis, with the composer at the piano?

elements.title: Pete Johnson (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Pete Johnson was the first Republican to hold statewide office in Mississippi since the Reconstruction era?

elements.title: Portrait of Count Stanislas Potocki (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Jacques-Louis David's Portrait of Count Stanislas Potocki from 1781 has been described as one of his masterpieces?

elements.title: Fred Bild (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that as a teenager in a B'nai B'rith camp in Canada, Holocaust survivor and future Canadian ambassador Fred Bild learned English from his camp counselor, future actor William Shatner?

elements.title: 13 Lakes (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the experimental film 13 Lakes, which consists of 13 ten-minute-long static shots of different lakes in the United States, was deemed to be significant by the Library of Congress?

elements.title: Gator Rivers (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Gator Rivers dribbled a basketball around chairs and under tables in a closet when trying out for the Harlem Globetrotters?

elements.title: 1971 Moroccan coup d'état attempt (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that though Mohamed Oufkir was appointed as Minister of Defence as a result of the 1971 Moroccan coup d'état attempt, he would later organize his own coup?

elements.title: Lonzo Anderson (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Lonzo Anderson "grew up rather like a rabbit" while unsupervised outdoors, anticipating his work on Two Hundred Rabbits?
